title: How to Make a Bow Ring Out of Clay

steps.headline: Get a small portion of the clay.
steps.description: It should be a square. Use a plastic knife in cutting.

steps.headline: Knead the clay.
steps.description: You want to make the clay easy to mold on. This kind of clay can be a little hard.

steps.headline: Roll the clay in to a circle.
steps.description: Roll it on a flat surface.

steps.headline: Roll the clay into an oval like shape.
steps.description: The length of it should be the same as your 3 fingers. This would be enough for your hand.

steps.headline: Roll it up and down.
steps.description: Make it a little thin. It should maintain the oval shape. Use anything for rolling. Avoid rolling to much or else the clay might stick to the surface and it may be destroyed when removed.

steps.headline: Remove the clay.
steps.description: Remove it gently. You want the clay to maintain its shape.

steps.headline: Make the two ends meet at the center.
Flip the clay then push the center.
steps.description: Use something a little sharp. Don't make a hole in it. Just push it.

steps.headline: Push some clay to the center.
steps.description: This will create a ribbon effect.

steps.headline: Get a small portion of the clay them mold it again.
steps.description: This clay should be smaller than the square that you used before.

steps.headline: Mold it into a long one.
steps.description: Kinda like a worm shape. Make it a little wide. Wide enough to fit the center of the ribbon.

steps.headline: Put the clay around the ribbon.
Bake the ribbon in an oven.
steps.description: You will see the information on the packing of your clay. Wait for it to harden while baking.

steps.headline: Add some designs.
steps.description: You can add clear or normal colored nail polish.

steps.headline: Add the varnish using clear nail polish You might want to put something beneath it to avoid mess.
steps.description: Wait a little bit to dry.

steps.headline: Put the ring base.
steps.description: Use glue, Glue gun is the best.

text: Molding the Clay Get a small portion of the clay. It should be a square. Use a plastic knife in cutting. Knead the clay. You want to make the clay easy to mold on. This kind of clay can be a little hard. Roll the clay in to a circle. Roll it on a flat surface. Roll the clay into an oval like shape. The length of it should be the same as your 3 fingers. This would be enough for your hand. Roll it up and down. Make it a little thin. It should maintain the oval shape. Use anything for rolling. Avoid rolling to much or else the clay might stick to the surface and it may be destroyed when removed. Remove the clay. Remove it gently. You want the clay to maintain its shape. Make the two ends meet at the center. Afterwards, push them. Flip the clay then push the center. Use something a little sharp. Don't make a hole in it. Just push it. Push some clay to the center. This will create a ribbon effect. Get a small portion of the clay them mold it again. This clay should be smaller than the square that you used before. Mold it into a long one. Kinda like a worm shape. Make it a little wide. Wide enough to fit the center of the ribbon. Put the clay around the ribbon. Cut the excess. Finishing the Ring Bake the ribbon in an oven. You will see the information on the packing of your clay. Wait for it to harden while baking. Add some designs. You can add clear or normal colored nail polish. Add the varnish using clear nail polish You might want to put something beneath it to avoid mess. Wait a little bit to dry. Put the ring base. Use glue, Glue gun is the best. Finished.
